de.dimensionv.java.libraries.common.utilities.file

Class FileUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.dimensionv.java.libraries.common.utilities.file.FileUtils

  • public class FileUtils
extends Object
    This class is a collection of useful routines regarding files, directories and URIs.

    Each method is available statically, which means there is no need to instantiate FileUtils. This is more memory efficient and allows for faster runtime then a class that has to be instantiated, first.

    Since:
    API 1.3.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Volkmar Seifert <vs@DimensionV.de>

    • Method Detail

      • isLocal

        public static boolean isLocal(String uri)
        Checks whether the URI represented by the String uri is a local one.

        Currently, this method checks against the schemes "http(s)" and "ftp(s)". Everything else is considered as "local", though this is of course not necessarily true.

        Parameters:
        uri - The URI to check against.
        Returns:
        true if the URI is considered as local, false otherwise.
        Since:
        Class 1.0, API 1.3.0

      • getExtension

        public static String getExtension(String path)
        Gets the extension of a file name, like ".png" or ".jpg".
        Parameters:
        path - The path to get the file extension from. Can also be a String-representation of a URI
        Returns:
        Extension including the dot("."); "" if there is no extension.
        Since:
        Class 1.0, API 1.3.0

      • getPathWithoutFilename

        public static File getPathWithoutFilename(File file)
        Returns the path only (without file name).
        Parameters:
        file - File-object to retrieve the path from.
        Returns:
        The path of the given File-object.
        Since:
        Class 1.0, API 1.3.0

      • getFile

        public static File getFile(URI uri)
        Transform a URI into a File.
        Parameters:
        uri - the URI to convert.
        Returns:
        file The new File-object.
        Throws:
        InvalidValueException - if the uri is somehow invalid.
        Since:
        Class 1.0, API 1.3.0

      • getFile

        public static File getFile(String path,
           String fileName)
        Create a File-object from a path and file name.
        Parameters:
        path - The path of the file.
        fileName - The name of the file.
        Returns:
        The File-object corresponding to the given path and filename.
        Since:
        Class 1.0, API 1.3.0

      • getFile

        public static File getFile(File path,
           String fileName)
        Create a File-object from a path and file name. This method uses the absolute path of the given path File-object to construct the new File-object representing the desired file.
        Parameters:
        path - A File-object corresponding to a directory, used for the path.
        fileName - The name of the file.
        Returns:
        The File-object corresponding to the given path and filename.
        Since:
        Class 1.0, API 1.3.0

      • getPath

        public static String getPath(URI uri)

        Get a file path from a URI.

        The URI's scheme must be "file://" for this to work, otherwise this method will throw an InvalidValueException.

        Parameters:
        uri - The URI-object to extract the path from.
        Returns:
        The path of the given URI-object
        Throws:
        InvalidValueException - Thrown when either the URI's scheme is not "file", or the returned path is null.
        Since:
        Class 1.0, API 1.3.0

      • getReadableFileSize

        public static String getReadableFileSize(long size)
        Get the file size in a human-readable string.
        Parameters:
        size - The file-size.
        Returns:
        The file-size in human-readable form.
        Since:
        Class 1.0, API 1.3.0

      • getFileList

        public static List<File> getFileList(String path,
                     boolean includeHidden)
        Get a list of Files in the give path.
        Parameters:
        path - The path to list the files of.
        includeHidden - Flag whether hidden files should be included or not.
        Returns:
        List of files in the given directory.
        Since:
        Class 1.0, API 1.3.0
